title: Golden Globes Fashion: Even With Minimal Red Carpet, Glamour Returned
sub_head: Some nominees and presenters put on the glitz for the Golden Globes, dressing up in gowns and formal outfits even though much of the awards ceremony unfolded online
body:
Stars, like us, are tired of Zoom tops and sweatpants.
At the Golden Globes on Sunday night, Hollywood celebrities amped up the glamour, even though most of them were Zooming in from hotels or their homes.
Some presenters who showed up in person on a socially distanced red carpet dressed up like old times, with Margot Robbie, Sofia Carson and Angela Bassett in dramatic gowns by Chanel, Giambattista Valli and Dolce & Gabbana, respectively.
The looks were a contrast with the Emmy Awards in September, where stars split between dressing down and relaxed or going glam.
On Sunday, several actresses expressed a desire to dress up after a challenging year and work-from-home comfort clothing. “I thought, you know, why not?” said Elle Fanning of her satin draped gown with embroidered crystal brooches, custom made by Gucci, and Fred Leighton jewels, during a pre-show television interview Ms. Fanning, a nominee for Best Actress in a television series, musical or comedy, for her role in “The Great,” added, “this year has been a very extreme year and is a very different year, so to have something to celebrate and to get dressed up for … is nice.”
